name: Chinese Chicken Salad with Asian Peanut Salad Dressing
description: A crunchy Chinese chicken salad tossed with a lip smackingly delicious peanut dressing, this is the sort of salad that's a truly satisfying meal in itself!
recipeIngredient: 1 tbsp canola oil ((or vegetable, grapeseed or peanut oil))
1 1/2 cups Chinese cabbage / Napa cabbage (, shredded)
1 1/2 cups carrots (, julienned (I used Just Veg pre shredded carrots) (Note 1))
1  shallot / green onion / scallion (, finely sliced on the diagonal)
1/4+  cups  crunchy fried noodles ((I use Changs))

recipeInstructions.text: Mix Dressing in a jug or small bowl. Use water to adjust consistency (it should be pretty thick and gloopy), Sriracha for spiciness and saltiness with salt (not more soy sauce).
recipeInstructions.name: Mix Dressing in a jug or small bowl. Use water to adjust consistency (it should be pretty thick and gloopy), Sriracha for spiciness and saltiness with salt (not more soy sauce).

recipeInstructions.text: Place all Salad ingredients in a bowl, reserving some noodles, peanuts and shallots for topping. Drizzled with Dressing and toss. Garnish with remaining noodles, peanuts and shallots and serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Place all Salad ingredients in a bowl, reserving some noodles, peanuts and shallots for topping. Drizzled with Dressing and toss. Garnish with remaining noodles, peanuts and shallots and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Yummy!! Made min3 without wombok, beansprouts and peanuts just because I didn't have them on hand haha but it was still delicious! I made it with fried tofu for myself and with poached chicken for hubby and miss 4 and they all loved it too
I made this recipe for my dinner and it was so delicious! My new favourite salad!
Made this using different veggies we had on hand. Soooo good!

Made this in prep for my two day shifts, had a little sample and its devine! I used the changi GF crispy noodles, GF light soy and poached some chicken breast to shred - its nice, fresh and tasty - will be making again! thank you
Made this today for a bring a plate lunch soooo delish
Really delicious, but the addition of mandarin oranges would have put it over the top!

I'm thrilled to find this recipe, especially the dressing.  It's the same stuff that was served at a BBQ joint in Ft. Walton Beach, Florida.  The best BBQ in the area, owned by an Asian family. It's been 20 years, I still fondly remember their food.
Made this tonight and absolutely loved it!!! Such a great dressing - genius!
Awesome recipe! So fresh and easy! I added fresh jicama and mint. Delicious and healthy. Yum!
I could eat this every day for lunch. Delicious!
